skills.name: Quadratic equations
skills.description: Solve quadratic equations by factoring, completing the square, and quadratic formula

templates.hint: Look for two numbers that multiply to {b} and add to {a}.
Use x = [-b ± √(b² - 4ac)] / 2a. Calculate the discriminant first.

templates.stem: Find the discriminant of {a}x² + {b}x + {c} = 0 and describe the nature of roots
templates.hint: The discriminant is b² - 4ac. If Δ > 0 (two roots), Δ = 0 (one root), Δ < 0 (no real roots).

skills.name: Simultaneous equations
skills.description: Solve systems of linear equations

templates.hint: Use elimination or substitution. Multiply one equation to make coefficients equal.
Substitute the first equation into the second, then solve for x.

skills.name: Polynomial operations
skills.description: Expand, factor, and simplify polynomials

templates.hint: Find factors of ac that add to b. Then group and factor out common terms.
Check if there's a common factor first. Then use the AC method.

skills.name: Trigonometric identities
skills.description: Prove and use basic trig identities

templates.stem: Prove tan θ = sin θ / cos θ
templates.answer: Use definitions: sin θ = opposite/hypotenuse, cos θ = adjacent/hypotenuse
templates.hint: Start with the definitions of sine and cosine in a right triangle. Divide them together.

skills.name: Statistical inference
skills.description: Confidence intervals and hypothesis testing basics

templates.hint: Arrange the numbers in order. The median is the middle value.

skills.name: Trigonometric exact values
skills.description: Find exact values of trig ratios for special angles

templates.stem: Find the exact value of sin({angle}°).
templates.hint: Recall the exact values: sin(30°) = 1/2, sin(45°) = √2/2, sin(60°) = √3/2.

skills.name: Matrix inverse
skills.description: Find the inverse of 2×2 matrices

templates.stem: Find the inverse of the matrix [[{a},{b}],[{c},{d}]] (ad - bc ≠ 0).
templates.hint: For [[a,b],[c,d]], the inverse is (1/determinant) × [[d,-b],[-c,a]].

skills.name: Normal distribution
skills.description: Calculate probabilities using the normal distribution

templates.stem: IQ scores are normally distributed with mean 100 and standard deviation 15. What percentage have IQ > {score}? Answer to nearest percent.
templates.hint: Standardize the score: z = (score - mean) / SD. Use the standard normal table.

skills.name: Quadratic discriminant
skills.description: Use the discriminant to determine nature of roots

templates.stem: For the quadratic {a}x² + {b}x + {c} = 0, find the discriminant and state the nature of the roots.
templates.hint: Discriminant = b² - 4ac. Two roots if > 0, one if = 0, none if < 0.

skills.name: Simplifying surds
skills.description: Simplify radical expressions

templates.hint: legacy

skills.name: Rationalising denominators
skills.description: Simplify radical expressions using conjugates

templates.hint: legacy

skills.name: Best buy problems
skills.description: Compare unit prices and ratios

templates.stem: (legacy) Brand A vs Brand B best buy question
templates.hint: legacy

skills.name: Solving nonlinear systems
skills.description: Solve nonlinear simultaneous equations graphically

templates.hint: legacy

skills.name: Matrix operations
skills.description: Addition, multiplication, determinants

templates.hint: Use row-by-column multiplication. First row × first column gives first element.
First calculate the determinant ad - bc. Then use the formula for 2×2 inverse.

skills.name: Circle geometry
skills.description: Equations, properties, theorems

templates.stem: Find the center and radius of x² + y² + {a}x + {b}y = {c}
templates.hint: Complete the square for both x and y terms to find the center and radius.

skills.name: Bivariate data analysis
skills.description: Correlation, regression lines

templates.stem: Data: x = {x1},{x2},{x3}; y = {y1},{y2},{y3}. Find correlation coefficient
templates.hint: Use the correlation formula r = Σ(xy) - nxy / √[Σ(x²) - nx²][Σ(y²) - ny²].

skills.name: Complex numbers - polar form
skills.description: Convert between rectangular and polar form

templates.stem: Convert {a} + {b}i to polar form r∠θ° (θ to nearest degree).
templates.hint: r = √(a² + b²) and θ = arctan(b/a). Check which quadrant to adjust angle.

skills.name: Functions and transformations
skills.description: Domain, range, function transformations, quadratic properties

templates.hint: The denominator cannot be zero. Solve x² - {a} = 0 to find excluded values.

templates.stem: Write the equation after translating f(x) = x² {h} units horizontally and {v} units vertically
templates.hint: Horizontal shift: replace x with (x - h). Vertical shift: add v to the function.

templates.stem: Find the maximum value of f(x) = -2x² + {a}x + {b}
templates.hint: For -2x² + {a}x + {b}, the vertex x-coordinate is -b/(2a) = {a}/4. Substitute to find max.

skills.name: Polynomials and algebraic methods
skills.description: Polynomial operations, simultaneous equations, inequalities

templates.hint: Use polynomial long division or synthetic division. The remainder is f(1).
Use substitution or elimination. From the second equation, express x in terms of y.
Find zeros at x = {a} and x = -{b}. Test intervals to determine where product is positive.

skills.name: Complex numbers and polar form
skills.description: Complex operations, polar form, De Moivre's theorem, complex plane

templates.hint: Use FOIL: (a+bi)(c+di) = ac + adi + bci + bdi². Remember i² = -1.
r = √(a² + b²). For θ, use arctan(b/a) and check the quadrant.
The modulus is the distance from origin: |z| = √(a² + b²).

skills.name: Sequences and series
skills.description: Arithmetic and geometric sequences, series sums, sigma notation

templates.stem: Find the {n}th term of the arithmetic sequence {a}, {b}, {c}, ...
templates.hint: First find common difference d = {b} - {a}. Then aₙ = a₁ + (n-1)d.

templates.stem: Find the sum of the geometric series: {a} + {ar} + {ar*r} + ... + {ar_n} ({n} terms)
templates.hint: For geometric series: Sₙ = a(rⁿ - 1)/(r - 1) where a is first term and r is common ratio.

templates.stem: Is the infinite geometric series 1 + 1/{a} + 1/{a*a} + ... convergent? If so, find the sum.
templates.hint: Infinite geometric series converges if |r| < 1. Sum = a/(1-r) when convergent.

skills.name: Exponential and logarithmic functions
skills.description: Exponential growth/decay, logarithm laws, solving exponential/log equations

templates.hint: Take log of both sides: x log({a}) = log({b}). Then x = log({b})/log({a}).
Use log laws: log(AB) = log(A) + log(B) and log(Aⁿ) = n log(A).

templates.stem: A population grows as P(t) = {a}e^({b}t). Find P at t = {t}
templates.hint: Substitute t = {t} into the exponential function: P({t}) = {a}e^({b}×{t}).

skills.name: Trigonometry and trigonometric functions
skills.description: Trig ratios, trig functions, identities, equations

templates.hint: Find the reference angle using arcsin({val}). Consider all quadrants where sine is positive.

templates.answer: Use Pythagorean identity from unit circle
templates.hint: On the unit circle, x = cos(θ) and y = sin(θ). Since x² + y² = 1, the identity follows.

templates.stem: Sketch y = {a}sin({b}x + {c}) and identify amplitude, period, phase shift
templates.hint: For y = A sin(Bx + C): amplitude = |A|, period = 360°/B, phase shift = -C/B.

skills.name: Conic sections and coordinate geometry
skills.description: Circles, parabolas, ellipses, hyperbolas, equations

templates.stem: Find the center and radius of the circle x² + y² + {a}x + {b}y + {c} = 0
templates.hint: Complete the square for both x and y. Rewrite in form (x-h)² + (y-k)² = r².
If both squared terms are positive and denominators are different, it's an ellipse.

templates.stem: Write the equation of the parabola with vertex ({h}, {k}) and directrix x = {d}
templates.hint: For parabola with vertex (h,k): if directrix is x = d, then (y-k)² = 4p(x-h) where p is distance to directrix.

skills.name: Limits and continuity
skills.description: Finding limits, limit laws, continuity, asymptotes

templates.hint: Factor the numerator: x² - 1 = (x-1)(x+1). Cancel (x-1) and evaluate.
Vertical asymptotes occur where denominator = 0. Solve x² - {a} = 0.

templates.stem: Is f(x) = {{x²} if x < 2, {a}x - 2 if x ≥ 2} continuous at x = 2?
templates.hint: Left limit: 2² = 4. Right limit: 2{a} - 2. For continuity, both must equal f(2).

skills.name: Derivatives and calculus applications
skills.description: Derivative rules, chain rule, optimization, curve sketching, integration basics

templates.hint: Use power rule: d/dx(xⁿ) = nxⁿ⁻¹. Derivative of constant is 0.

templates.stem: Find the derivative of f(x) = e^({a}x) using chain rule
templates.hint: Chain rule: d/dx(e^(ax)) = a × e^(ax). The derivative of the exponent is a.

templates.stem: A company's profit is P(x) = -{a}x² + {b}x - {c}. Find the number of units for maximum profit.
templates.hint: Maximum occurs at critical points. Set P'(x) = 0: -{2*a}x + {b} = 0. Solve for x.

skills.name: Probability and statistics
skills.description: Probability, distributions, hypothesis testing, confidence intervals

templates.stem: In a sample of {n}, the standard deviation is {sd}. Find the 95% confidence interval for the mean if x̄ = {mean}
templates.hint: 95% CI = x̄ ± 1.96(σ/√n). Substitute values into the formula.

templates.stem: If P(A) = {pa} and P(B) = {pb} and events are independent, find P(A and B)
templates.hint: For independent events: P(A and B) = P(A) × P(B).

templates.stem: Data is normally distributed with μ = {mu} and σ = {sigma}. Find P(X > {val})
templates.hint: Standardize: Z = (X - μ)/σ. Then use standard normal table.
